meanings.definition: In a methodical or organized manner.
meanings.sent1: She cleaned her room systematically, starting from one corner and moving to the next.
meanings.sent2: The librarian shelved the books systematically, arranging them by genre and author.
meanings.sent3: The ants worked systematically to gather food for their colony, each following a specific route.
meanings.sent4: The detective approached the case systematically, analyzing each clue with precision.
meanings.sent5: The factory assembly line moved systematically, with each worker completing their task before passing it on.

meanings.definition: According to a system or plan.
meanings.sent1: The students were instructed to solve the math problems systematically, following the steps provided.
meanings.sent2: The chef cooked the dish systematically, following the recipe without skipping any ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum cleaner moved systematically around the room, covering every inch of the floor.
meanings.sent4: The project manager organized the tasks systematically, ensuring each step was completed before moving to the next.
meanings.sent5: The musician tuned his guitar systematically, adjusting each string carefully to achieve the perfect sound.

meanings.definition: In a consistent or regular way.
meanings.sent1: The clock chimed systematically every hour, marking the passage of time.
meanings.sent2: The gardener watered the plants systematically, following a set schedule to ensure they thrived.
meanings.sent3: The waves crashed systematically against the shore, creating a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The athlete trained systematically, sticking to a strict regimen to improve performance.
meanings.sent5: The writer wrote systematically, setting aside dedicated time each day to work on the novel.
